abstract: Mr. Kearns’s passion for education reform caught the attention of the first Bush administration, which tapped him to join the Education Department as a deputy secretary in 1991.
snippet: Mr. Kearns’s passion for education reform caught the attention of the first Bush administration, which tapped him to join the Education Department as a deputy secretary in 1991.
lead_paragraph: David T. Kearns, a former chief executive at the Xerox Corporation and a champion of education reform who served as deputy secretary of education under the first President George Bush, died Friday at a hospice near his winter home in Vero Beach, Fla. He was 80.

headline.main: David T. Kearns, Champion of Education Reform, Dies at 80
headline.print_headline: David T. Kearns, Leader In Education, Dies at 80
